title: Perla del Garda 2015 Perla  (Lugana)
description: This opens with aromas of ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus. The bright, juicy palate offers mature pear, peach and nectarine while a pleasantly bitter almond note fills in the finish.

title: François Lurton 2013 Santa Celina Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, field-like aromas include plum and currant. This Malbec shows tough, edgy tannins and toasty black-plum flavors. A bit of heat and burn is detectable on a bold, rugged finish.

title: Girlan 2013 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Subdued aromas of ripe dark berry, violet, spice and a whiff of Alpine herb come together on this. The lively, straightforward palate offers up black raspberry, blackberry and nutmeg alongside velvety tannins. Drink soon.

title: Erste Neue 2011 Puntay Riserva Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Subtle aromas of dark berry, tilled earth and baking spice lead the nose. The ripe, juicy palate doles out mature plum, cassis, anise and black pepper alongside round, solid tannins. Drink through 2018.

title: Kitá 2013 Spe'y Camp 4 Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a concentrated forest floor funk to the nose of this intriguing blend of 58% Grenache, 21% Syrah and 21% Carignane, as well as sweet root vegetable, blueberry, black plum and dried beef aromas. The palate is very wound up in a reductive, tarry tensions, with elderberry fruit and incense oil flavors. Needs some time to unfurl.

title: Domaine du Dragon 2015 Grande Cuvée Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From clay and limestone soil, this wine is full bodied. It has both spice and a tight, nervy, mineral texture. Rich with a full mouthful of raspberry and red-currant fruits, it has a refreshing aftertaste.

title: Domaine Sainte-Marie 2015 VieVité Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: From vineyards close to Saint-Tropez on the Mediterranean coast, this wine has swathes of ripe, sunny fruits with just a hint of cooler breezes to bring out the acidity. It's an immediately attractive, fruity wine, refreshing and packed with orange and raspberry flavors.

title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2015 Simone Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Named after the mother of the current grower, this wine is a Rhône-like blend of Syrah and Grenache. The result is a fresh wine with an edge of tannins that give it structure. A ripe wine, it has also preserved its crisp, bright fruitiness.

title: Domingo Molina 2015 Hermanos Torrontés (Salta)
description: Surface-level lemon and tropical fruit notes give way to a fresh, clean palate. Powdery, melony flavors of green banana and papaya finish slightly oily and bitter, which is normal for the grape type. Drink immediately.

title: McKinney 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Green apples, apple blossoms, fresh Meyer lemon, tangerine skin and a bit of chalk show on the complex nose of this bottling, which is boosted by 5% Viognier. The flavors are fairly light, with energetic lime juice, apple flesh and tart apple skins in the midpalate.

title: Merriam 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Pink-orange in color, this is a tangy, high-acid wine that's not for everyone, given its bracing mix of tangerine and grapefruit. Light-bodied, yet textured, it's a good quaffer and food-friendly companion.

title: Michel Gassier 2014 Les Piliers Cabernet Sauvignon (Vin de France)
description: An attractive and ripely fruited Cab, this opens with lush aromas of blackberry, raspberry preserves and black plum that are complemented by spicy notes of bittersweet chocolate, toasted oak, pepper and cigar-box spice. The plush mouthfeel offers medium tannins and dense black-fruit flavors that linger on the spicy finish.

title: Ancilla 2015 1909  (Lugana)
description: Aromas of pressed flower, nut and a whiff of citrus lead the nose. The ripe, juicy palate delivers tangerine, mature Golden Delicious and a hint of bitter almond alongside bright acidity.

title: August Ridge 2010 Nebbiolo (Paso Robles)
description: Cola, dried strawberry, maraschino cherries and shaved cedar show on the nose of this bottling from East Paso. Lighter cherry tones meet with bloody iron and more cola notes on the palate. A lighter style of Nebbiolo, this would pair with a wide range of foods, much like a Pinot Noir.

title: Barton 2014 The Broken Road Clare Ranch Viognier (Templeton Gap District)
description: Freshly squeezed peaches, peach custard and ripe melon make for a rich nose on this bottling, but they remain balanced and light rather than treacly. Yellow peach, apple custard and cherimoya fruit show on the palate, where a lime peel edge cuts through the touch of browned marshmallow.

title: Bedell 2013 Syrah (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Despite its delicate frame, there's an explosion of ripe, luscious black cherry and peppery spice here. Sunny acidity and fine, soft tannins lend a plush feel to the palate. It's approachable and easy drinking but elegantly balanced.

title: Belisario 2014 Vigneti B  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
description: Made with organically farmed grapes and produced with certified organic vinification practices, this unusual white has a deep golden color and a fragrance of pressed yellow flower and toasted almond. The round, medium-bodied palate delivers ripe tangerine, white almond, mineral and a hint of honey alongside tangy acidity.

title: Vignerons de Correns 2015 Croix de Basson Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this wine is full of fragrant, clean red-fruit flavors. It is ripe and full bodied—perhaps too full-bodied for a really fresh rosé. It does have all the fruit, generous and with a soft aftertaste.

title: Villa Sparina 2013 Monterotondo del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)
description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and citrus lead the way while the racy, linear palate offers nectarine, mineral and bitter almond. Zesty acidity provides the framework.

title: Markus Huber 2015 Hugo Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: An almost neutral nose nonetheless gives slight hints of crisp citrus. An ultralight body provides easy, clean-cut drinking with a superdry, citrussy finish. Drink soon.

title: Canoe Ridge 2012 Estate Grown Blocks 10, 11 & 12 Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of coffee, vanilla, woodspice and red fruit are at the fore. The cranberry and cherry flavors are quite sweet, backed by astringent tannins. The oak dominates at times.

title: Château de la Galinière 2015 Le Cengle Vieilles Vignes Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The 73-acre vineyard of Galinière is close to Aix-en-Provence at the western end of the Côtes de Provence vineyards. Named after the plateau where the vines grow, it is a bright, spicy wine that shows refreshing acidity along with lemon and grapefruit flavors. The wine finishes in a burst of juiciness.

title: Château d'Ollières 2012 Prestige Red (Coteaux Varois)
description: This blend of old-vine Grenache and Syrah has weight, richness and, after three years aging, maturity. The wine is smooth, juicy and full of ripe berry fruits. Acidity keeps it juicy and fruity, sustained with a background of dusty, perfumed tannins. Drink now and until 2022.

title: Bodegas Carballal 2014 Floreano e Punto Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Tropical fruit aromas blend with a waxy lanolin note as well as a bready scent. This feels round and a touch clunky. A mix of peach and citrus flavors finish pithy but solid. Drink up.

title: Boeger 2015 Hangtown Gold Lot #16 White (El Dorado)
description: This jazzy wine has enticing floral aromas and ripe, almost sweet flavors like a lemon tart. Light to medium-bodied, it offers a refreshing balance, smooth texture and absolutely fresh fruits and spices.

title: Boheme 2012 English Hill Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a cool site in view of Tomales Bay, this is a sharp, austere and nutty wine, whole-cluster pressed and put into neutral French oak. The minerality is the stand-out, with a lithe body and crispness that's hard to deny.

title: Château Vannières 2015 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This is so pale that it is almost a vision of white wine. Once tasted, red fruits and tangy freshness give the right richness, while acidity leads to the crisp aftertaste. The estate also has vines in the Bandol appellation.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2012 Choreography Red (Livermore Valley)
description: A deep color and equally deep prune and black cherry flavors give a lot of oomph to this full-bodied but smooth textured wine. Made from Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, it is dry, slightly tannic but mostly just generous and easy to enjoy.

title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2015 Cuvée Spéciale Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A rounded style of rosé, this is ripe and soft, with acidity cushioned by the rich red fruits. The aftertaste with its lemon-zest touch makes this wine refreshing.

title: Broken Earth 2012 CV Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dried purple flowers, tobacco, espresso and black currant fruit show on the nose of this top-end bottling from the large winery on Paso's Eastside. Red currant, red plum and dried strawberry pop on the fresh and juicy palate, and those fruits are then leveled by graphite and dried tobacco on the finish.
